oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Stax Backers' Talk..."
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Stax Backers Talk Sounds Like Broken Record," The Commercial Appeal, Memphis, TN. Third in a series of three articles. This third article discusses how Stax was closed for business in 1976 as mandated by federal court. It briefly discusses the possible future of Stax and the Memphis Sound.

Stax Records was a major catalyst in the creation of Southern and Memphis soul music. Founded in 1957 by two white siblings and business partners, Jim Stewart and Estelle Axton (STewart/AXton = Stax), the label was renowned for its output of African-American music and integrated bands. It had a racially integrated team of staff and artists, at that time unprecedented both in Memphis and the South.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Stax Records; Soul music--United States; Music and race
